title: Infrastructure Update Map, Port au Prince and Surrounding Area, 2010 Haiti Earthquake
name: Infrastructure Update Map, Port au Prince and Surrounding Area, 2010 Haiti Earthquake
description:
This dataset displays points around Port-au-Prince and the surrounding area in Haiti that give updates to various affected infrastructure.

The data comes from logcluster.com with sources coming from OCHA, UNHRD, NBC, AFP.

Other points of interest that were damaged but not mappable: 
Many public/Government buildings collapsed: Presidential palace, Ministry of Finances, Ministry of Public Works, Ministry of Communications and Culture, Justice Palace, High Normal School, Parliament Buildings, Port-au-Prince Cathedral, UN Compound has been severley damaged apart from WFP office, several hospitals destroyed, water infrastructure affected, electricity and communications disrupted.

properties.name: Petionville
properties.notes: a building of at least 3 floors collapsed and hospital was reported as wrecked with people trapped inside

properties.name: Canape Vert
properties.notes: one of the main roads that leads from the downtown area of Port-au-Prince to Petionville has collapsed near the area of Delmas 60. Sections of the road slid down the mountain into homes which where built into the mountainside

properties.name: MINUSTAH HQ
properties.notes: MINUSTAH HQ Collapsed; WFP office location

properties.name: Port-au-Prince
properties.notes: port is currently non-operational; Quayside is badly damaged with debrisunder water line

properties.name: Port-au-Prince International Airport
properties.notes: airport control tower severely damaged; very limited access because of debris and other obstacles on the roads; only open for humanitarian, military, and private flights; currently visual landing/radio assisted only
